result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud. Tapping/Wires/Meters/Pipes(Other), a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.36(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Eugene Landon

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will be pleading to all counts. State will request restitution, advise court of defendant's record, and remain silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accepts plead and finds defendant guilty. State heard on restitution and remains silent as to a sentencing recommendation. Attorney Richards heard. Defendant not heard. Court heard and orders: Ct 1- 1 year probation with the following conditions: pay restitution in the amount of $488.86 and court costs, Cts 2-4: 4 years WSPS (2in and 2out)-STAYED and imposes 3 years probation with the following conditions: to participate in counseling that DOC deems appropriate, to submit to random observed drug testing, to maintain full time employment or seek a rate of 5 job applications per week, court waives costs, and to provide a DNA sample. If revoked, 29 days credit granted. Defendant is eligible for substance abuse but not challenges.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richards does not appear due to schedule conflict. Prior to this hearing, Attorney Richards made Court aware of outcome of bond modification hearing with JVD from earlier today. Court heard and bond modification request denied. Status date remains.
Bail/bond hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Nicholas Eugene Landon.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Chad Chappell sworn and testified. Attorney Pozorski asks court to take judicial notice of Crawford Cty case 22CF77, Lafayette Cty case 21CF72, and Grant Cty case 22CF43. Court takes notice. Cross. Follow up. Attorney Richards heard. Attorney Pozorksi heard. Court binds matter over. Information filed. Attorney Richard heard on bond and requests a signature bond. Attorney Pozorski objects to a signature bond. Court heard and orders bond to remain as is. Defendant waives formal reading and pleads not guilty to charges. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on November 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Richard appears via phone. Attorney Richard has not been appointed in this case yet. Defendant says he applied for SPD for this case. Defendant to contact SPD. Attorney Richards heard. Preliminary hearing set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas Eugene Landon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant qualifies for SPD. Contact SPD as soon as possible. State requests $1000 cash bond. Court orders $3000 cash bond concurrent with 22CF43, 22CF113 and 22CF175. Status as to counsel set.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
